AI.description: The AI competitors will add logic to this AI so its functions return valid and smart values.

runTurn.description: This is called every time the AI is asked to respond with a command during their turn

return.description: the Command you want to run on the server this turn from a game object's command functions. If you do not return your player's endTurn() then this runTurn function will be called again after the game state updates.

boardHeight.description: The height of the board for the Y component of a checker.

boardWidth.description: The width of the board for X component of a checker.

checkerMoved.description: The checker that last moved and must be moved because only one checker can move during each players turn.

checkerMovedJumped.description: If the last checker that moved jumped, meaning it can move again.

checkers.description: All the checkers currently in the game.

currentPlayer.description: The player whose turn it is currently. That player can send commands. Other players cannot.

currentTurn.description: The current turn number, starting at 0 for the first player's turn

gameObjects.description: A mapping of every game object's ID to the actual game object. Primarily used by the server and client to easily refer to the game objects via ID.

maxTurns.description: The maximum number of turns before the game will automatically end.

players.description: List of all the players in the game.

Game.description: The simple version of American Checkers. An 8x8 board with 12 checkers on each side that must move diagonally to the opposing side until kinged. Very simple.
Game.name: Checkers

kinged.description: If the checker has been kinged and can move backwards.

owner.description: The player that controls this Checker.

x.description: The x coordinate of the checker.

y.description: The y coordinate of the checker.

Checker.description: A checker on the game board.

arguments.description: The x coordinate to move to.
arguments.name: x

arguments.description: The y coordinate to move to.
arguments.name: y

move.description: Moves the checker from its current location to the given (x, y).

return.description: the command for the server to run this function against game logic, then send back the updated game state

id.description: A unique id for each instance of a GameObject or a sub class. Used for client and server communication. Should never change value after being set.

logs.description: Any strings logged will be stored here when this game object logs the strings. Intended for debugging.

arguments.description: A string to add to this GameObject's log. Intended for debugging.
arguments.name: message

log.description: adds a message to this game object's log. Intended for debugging purposes.

lost.description: if the player lost the game or not

reasonLost.description: the reason why the player lost the game

reasonWon.description: the reason why the player won the game

timeRemaining.description: The amount of time (in ms) remaining for this AI to send commands.

won.description: if the player won the game or not

yDirection.description: The direction your checkers must go along the y-axis until kinged

Player.description: A player in this game. Every AI controls one player.
